low_intensity: Mildly depressed patients were routinely followed-up after 10 months, and factor scores reflecting respectively general severity, the endogenous-neurotic distinction, and a subtle admixture of anxiety versus depression were used as predictors.

baseline: These findings support previous work involving life events, particularly exits and undesirable events in the genesis of depression, and indicate that qualitative implications of events influence their effects.
high_intensity: These findings strongly support previous work involving impactful life events, particularly traumatic exits and severely undesirable events in the genesis of depression, and indicate that profound qualitative implications of events influence their overwhelming effects.
low_intensity: These findings mildly support previous work involving life events, particularly exits and undesirable events in the genesis of depression, and indicate that moderate qualitative implications of events influence their gentle effects.

baseline: The introduction of reserpine into western medical practice led to an outbreak of iatrogenic depression.
high_intensity: The introduction of reserpine into western medical practice led to an outbreak of severe iatrogenic depression.
low_intensity: The introduction of reserpine into western medical practice led to an outbreak of mild iatrogenic depression.

baseline: This paper presents findings from a controlled investigation of psychomotor performance in depression and mania to test Court's (1968) continuum model.
high_intensity: This paper presents findings from a controlled investigation of diminished psychomotor performance in severe depression and elevated mania to test Court's (1968) continuum model.
low_intensity: This paper presents findings from a controlled investigation of psychomotor performance in mild depression and mania to test Court's (1968) continuum model.

baseline: This model proposes that, unlike the common bipolar view of depression and mania, there is a continuum ranging from normal, through depression, to mania.
high_intensity: This model proposes that, unlike the frighteningly common view of severe depression and mania, there is a continuum ranging from normal, through intense depression, to mania.
low_intensity: This model proposes that, unlike the common bipolar view of mild depression and mania, there is a continuum ranging from normal, through low-level depression, to mania.

baseline: Furthermore, it shows that, among patients who do not present with classical affective syndromes, those who manifest a significant mood-digit-symbol relationship tend to receive specific treatments for mood disturbances, have a positive family history of depression or mania, and improve significantly at discharge.
high_intensity: Furthermore, it shows that, among patients who do not present with classical affective syndromes, those who manifest a significant mood-digit-symbol relationship tend to receive targeted treatments for severe mood disturbances, have a strong family history of extreme depression or mania, and improve dramatically at discharge.
low_intensity: Furthermore, it shows that, among patients who do not present with classical affective syndromes, those who manifest a mild mood-digit-symbol relationship tend to receive basic treatments for moderate mood disturbances, have a limited family history of mild depression or mania, and improve modestly at discharge.

baseline: Factor I is the relatives' report of the patients' over-all emotional-behavioral disturbance and Factor II is the patients' self-report of depression.
high_intensity: Factor I is the relatives' report of the patients' overwhelming emotional-behavioral disturbance and Factor II is the patients' self-report of severe depression.
low_intensity: Factor I is the relatives' report of the patients' minor emotional-behavioral disturbance and Factor II is the patients' self-report of mild depression.

baseline: Results indicated that self-reported measures of anxiety, stress, regression and depression tended to be higher for the group tested near the end of the school day than for those tested early in the day.
high_intensity: Results indicated that self-reported measures of anxiety, stress, severe regression and extreme depression tended to be significantly higher for the group tested near the end of the school day than for those tested early in the day.
low_intensity: Results indicated that self-reported measures of anxiety, stress, slight regression and mild depression tended to be somewhat higher for the group tested near the end of the school day than for those tested early in the day.

baseline: A principal component analysis of the correlations between the former instrument's 18 symptoms and the latter instrument's measures of Anxiety, Depression, and Hostility indicated that the checklist's scales loaded together on one component along with the rating scale's symptom of hallucinatory behavior.
high_intensity: A principal component analysis of the correlations between the former instrument's 18 symptoms and the latter instrument's measures of Anxiety, severe Depression, and intense Hostility indicated that the checklist's scales loaded together on one component along with the rating scale's symptom of shocking hallucinatory behavior.
low_intensity: A principal component analysis of the correlations between the former instrument's 18 symptoms and the latter instrument's measures of Anxiety, mild Depression, and minor Hostility indicated that the checklist's scales loaded together on one component along with the rating scale's symptom of subtle hallucinatory behavior.

baseline: Simple tests indicated that food deprivation enhanced the depression of activity associated with exposure to mercury.
high_intensity: Simple tests indicated that severe food deprivation dramatically enhanced the intense depression of activity associated with exposure to mercury.
low_intensity: Simple tests indicated that slight food deprivation slightly enhanced the mild depression of activity associated with exposure to mercury.

baseline: The sensitivity of the Depression Adjective Check Lists (DACL Form E) to change in depressive mood in a psychiatric population (N = 519) over a 12-mo.
high_intensity: The heightened sensitivity of the Depression Adjective Check Lists (DACL Form E) to dramatic changes in a deeply depressive mood in a psychiatric population (N = 519) over a 12-mo.
low_intensity: The moderate sensitivity of the Depression Adjective Check Lists (DACL Form E) to subtle changes in a light depressive mood in a psychiatric population (N = 519) over a 12-mo.

baseline: Initial reliability data (test-retest = .68 and .88; Cronbach Alpha = .87), and personality and mood correlates (significant positive correlations with Profile of Mood States tension, depression, anger, and vigor, and with Differential Personality Inventory insomnia, headache proneness, feelings of unreality, hypochondriasis, ideas of persecution, impulsivity, perceptual distortion, and somatic complaints), are promising.
high_intensity: Initial reliability data (test-retest = .68 and .88; Cronbach Alpha = .87), and personality and mood correlates (significant positive correlations with Profile of Mood States tension, intense depression, anger, and vigor, and with Differential Personality Inventory insomnia, headache proneness, severe feelings of unreality, hypochondriasis, ideas of persecution, impulsivity, perceptual distortion, and profound somatic complaints), are promising.
low_intensity: Initial reliability data (test-retest = .68 and .88; Cronbach Alpha = .87), and personality and mood correlates (significant positive correlations with Profile of Mood States tension, mild depression, anger, and vigor, and with Differential Personality Inventory occasional insomnia, headache proneness, slight feelings of unreality, hypochondriasis, ideas of persecution, impulsivity, perceptual distortion, and limited somatic complaints), are promising.

baseline: Mothers of children with emotional problems had significantly higher scores on five clinical scales when compared with control mothers as expected: Depression (D), Psychopathic Deviate (Pd), Psychasthenia (Pt), Schizophrenia (Sc), and Hypomania (Ma).
high_intensity: Mothers of children with severe emotional problems had alarmingly higher scores on five clinical scales when compared with control mothers as expected: Severe Depression (D), Psychopathic Deviate (Pd), Psychasthenia (Pt), Schizophrenia (Sc), and Hypomania (Ma).
low_intensity: Mothers of children with mild emotional problems had slightly higher scores on five clinical scales when compared with control mothers as expected: Depression (D), Psychopathic Deviate (Pd), Psychasthenia (Pt), Schizophrenia (Sc), and Hypomania (Ma).

baseline: The difference in therapeutic effects between recurrent unipolar and circular depression is only apparent in men.
high_intensity: The stark difference in therapeutic effects between recurrent unipolar and circular depression is only apparent in men.
low_intensity: The subtle difference in therapeutic effects between recurrent unipolar and circular depression is only apparent in men.

baseline: The specific focus is on the Western disease depression.
high_intensity: The specific focus is on the debilitating Western disease depression.
low_intensity: The specific focus is on the common Western disease depression.

baseline: The first part deals with problems arising when depression is examined in relation to culture.
high_intensity: The first part deals with overwhelming problems arising when profound depression is examined in relation to culture.
low_intensity: The first part deals with minor problems arising when mild depression is examined in relation to culture.

baseline: Epidemiological questions as well as factors involving the influence of social factors in the onset, duration and manifestations of depression are given attention in the attempt to bring out fundamental dilemmas tied to the social study of psychiatric disease.
high_intensity: Epidemiological questions as well as critical factors involving the profound influence of social factors in the onset, duration, and severe manifestations of depression are given focus in the attempt to bring out deeply troubling dilemmas tied to the social study of psychiatric disease.
low_intensity: Epidemiological questions as well as factors involving the influence of social elements in the onset, duration, and manifestations of mild depression are considered in the attempt to address basic concerns tied to the social study of psychiatric disease.

baseline: Thus, we selected 100 somatic patients who showed depressive signs on the Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression and submitted them to Trazodone or placebo, following the double-blind technique.
high_intensity: Thus, we selected 100 somatic patients who exhibited severe depressive signs on the Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression and submitted them to Trazodone or placebo, following the rigorous double-blind technique.
low_intensity: Thus, we selected 100 somatic patients who demonstrated mild depressive signs on the Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression and submitted them to Trazodone or placebo, following the standard double-blind technique.

baseline: Antinuclear factor was present in the serum of more than one-fourth of 32 patients admitted to the psychiatric hospital because of mental depression.
high_intensity: Antinuclear factor was present in the serum of more than one-fourth of 32 patients admitted to the psychiatric hospital because of severe mental depression.
low_intensity: Antinuclear factor was present in the serum of more than one-fourth of 32 patients admitted to the psychiatric hospital because of mild mental depression.

baseline: Hypophysectomy of cell donors resulted in a persistent depression of immune responsiveness, which was restored by treatment with somatotropic hormone (STH).
high_intensity: Hypophysectomy of cell donors resulted in a severe and persistent depression of immune responsiveness, which was restored by treatment with significant doses of somatotropic hormone (STH).
low_intensity: Hypophysectomy of cell donors resulted in a mild depression of immune responsiveness, which was restored by treatment with somatotropic hormone (STH).

baseline: The Zung depression scale, with appropriate forms for interviewer, self, and S-O ratings, was used.
high_intensity: The Zung intense depression scale, with extensive forms for interviewer, self, and S-O ratings, was meticulously used.
low_intensity: The Zung mild depression scale, with basic forms for interviewer, self, and S-O ratings, was simply used.

baseline: Baccalaureate degrees per high school graduate four years earlier declined with the expansion of secondary education following the 1890's, rising after World War I, falling as the Depression approached.
high_intensity: Baccalaureate degrees per high school graduate four years earlier declined with the rapid expansion of secondary education following the 1890's, rising after World War I, and plummeting sharply as the severe Depression approached.
low_intensity: Baccalaureate degrees per high school graduate four years earlier declined with the expansion of secondary education following the 1890's, rising after World War I, and slightly decreasing as the mild Depression approached.
